thread.title: Dantonio names the play, activates another freshman
thread.title_full: Dantonio names the play, activates another freshman

title: Dantonio names the play, activates another freshman
text:
Dantonio names the play, activates another freshman Joe Rexrode, Detroit Free Press 12:59 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Michigan State football coach Mark Dantonio and basketball coach Tom Izzo were in good moods Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015. Video by Joe Rexrode / DFP Michigan State Spartans defensive back Jalen Watts-Jackson dives into the end zone for a game winning touchdown as the clock runs out in the fourth quarter against the Michigan Wolverines at Michigan Stadium. (Photo: Rick Osentoski-USA TODAY Sports) 18 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
EAST LANSING - You might prefer "Punt Bunyan" (ESPN's idea), "The Gift Six" (CBS), or one of several fan submissions including "Watts Happening" and "The Jackson Six." 
But Mark Dantonio has officially named the 38-yard fumble return for a touchdown by Jalen Watts-Jackson after a muffed punt to win as time expired Saturday at Michigan. 
"Rangers," Dantonio said. "Rangers: Mission 4:10. How about that? There you go. That's it. We're on to Indiana." 
But first, an explanation. "Rangers" is the name of the punt-block team MSU put on the field to try to force a mistake. The 4 represents what MSU coaches told players all last week, that the mental aspect of the game would be four times more important than the physical aspects. 
And the 10 represents the 10 seconds on the clock when the final play began â€” after Dantonio had his players sit on the bus for 10 seconds to think about what needed to be done when the team arrived at Michigan Stadium on Saturday. 
As for the Hoosiers (4-3, 0-3 Big Ten), they represent a big test for the still-shuffling secondary of the No. 7 Spartans (7-0, 3-0). Starting cornerback Darian Hicks is questionable after missing the Michigan game with a concussion, and Dantonio said true freshman cornerback Tyson Smith will be activated this week for the first time. 
He said true freshman cornerback Josh Butler also could be activated. 18 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.lsj.com/1LIF7C4 TOP VIDEOS
